SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Little is known about psychiatric symptoms in Vascular dementia (VaD)
METHOD: 92 patients with VaD, and 92 patients with Alzheimer's disease (AD) are reported
The evaluation included standardised measures of mood and psychosis
RESULTS: 72% of VaD patients and 38% of those with AD had two or more anxiety symptoms
VaD patients with severe dementia (94%) were the most likely to be anxious
Depression was also significantly more common in VaD patients (19% vs. 8%) whereas psychotic symptoms were prevalent in both dementias
CONCLUSION: Psychiatric symptoms are common in VaD, especially in patients with moderate or severe dementia
Rigorous assessment of psychiatric symptoms in VaD should be part of good clinical practice
